description.value:
These goggles of smoked glass are used by membrane ghibranis of Elytrio to protect their eyes during the frequent dust storms in the wastes of their ravaged planet. When you wear a pair of dust goggles, the penalty to @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.gZlg2ZKze0erNLmP]{Perception} checks from storms is removed and your visibility range isn’t reduced (see @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.SfkuzH5kxSAmG4nv.JournalEntryPage.llyS6o5YJKCTqKkG]{Weather} on page 398 of the Starfinder Core Rulebook). In addition, you reduce your miss chance due to concealment from @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.SfkuzH5kxSAmG4nv.JournalEntryPage.n461i9lDXw303SiY#smoke-effects]{smoke} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.SfkuzH5kxSAmG4nv.JournalEntryPage.llyS6o5YJKCTqKkG]{fog} (including that produced by a @Compendium[sfrpg.equipment.9zAxjLCJAxWuPMgw]{Smoke grenade} or an effect such as @Compendium[sfrpg.spells.UVzRPQeiV2yl6QAn]{Fog Cloud}) by 10% (to a minimum of 0%); this reduction doesn’t stack with any other ability that reduces miss chance due to concealment.

Dust goggles can also be installed in armor (or an @Compendium[sfrpg.races.GHIntVN70xTt2Tlo]{Android}’s armor upgrade slot) as an armor upgrade. This has no effect on weight or cost, but when installed in this way, they do not count toward a character’s limit of two worn magic or hybrid items at once.
